text: Hi, does anyway have any suggestions on how to defer HubSpot form scripts? PageSpeedInsights flags HubSpot forms under “Reduce unused JavaScript” and I can’t see how I can defer these :smiling_face_with_tear:

I'd look at creating some macros to make your code simpler, and loop through your objects and push data to the macros to build out the items. 

You may want to return items as strings and append them, or use arrays and push them, then print out afterwards. 

You could also put your loops inside a JavaScript array of objects and build it out with a script instead

it isn't an unused script. So the guidance of pagespeed insights is trash here. 

If you want to get around JavaScript and forms, you need to hood html forms and push to the forms api

That will really show oagespeed insights!
That's awesome! but for me to test you page what type of value do you expect on the above line?

When you do `|pprint` that is pretty much display the object properties.

same as `|tojson` — SO THAT BEING SAID — all of these are property is of the object

`{{ contact.first_name }}` would be how you get the first name of the contact. Is that what you are asking?
